comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Photographer Henry King was at the other end at about the same time (see LH pavement, unless one image needs flipping).  See comments etc - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/4903243213/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Ha! You can see the bollards / oildrums / roadblock at the other end of the King photo at hi-res here - www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=30608

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for the links beachcomber. Wow, those images are quite similar and it's possible they may have both been there at the same time. They may have been on the same side as this is a glass plate negative. Also, there aren't any properties on the land in the background, and the bridge was built to encourage developments on the other side.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
